newsitem.title: MEXICO: MEXICO CETES RATE UP ON SOFT PESO, SPECULATION.
newsitem.headline: MEXICO CETES RATE UP ON SOFT PESO, SPECULATION.

text.p: Mexican overnight Cetes rates ended up 175 basis points at 18.75 percent on Thursday under pressure from speculation and a weaker peso, dealers said.
"The market was volatile and pushed around by players with hefty liquidity positions," a trader said.
Benchmark 48-hour peso contracts closed 2.95 centavos weaker at 7.8075/7.8125.
Dealers said rates also rose under the influence of the U.S. 30-year Treasury bond, which was down 20/32 to yield 6.53 percent in late dealing.
Dealers said secondary rates could ease downwards on Friday following the release of mild inflation data just after trade closed on Thursday.
Banco de Mexico announced consumer prices in July increased by 0.87 percent, compared to 0.88 percent predicted in a previously conducted Reuters survey.
Banco de Mexico drained 2.498 billion peso from the market. Overnight rates on bank paper closed up 125 basis points at 20.00 percent.
Liquidity of 964 million pesos was scheduled to return to the system on Friday from prior central bank participation.
